DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Inventory Past 24 Hours Severity Other Symptom at its Worst Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An individual's stated perception of the severity of another symptom, not previously reported, at its worst in the last 24 hours, using an eleven-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Symptom Assessment Questionnaire Past 24 Hour Severity Other Symptom Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._Before the present time._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::24_In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A predetermined set of questions.

Property.preferredName: Past Integer::24 Hour Severity Other Symptom Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::24:In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Before the present time.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR per request by D.Reeves. mc 12/19/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Absent To As Bad as You Can Imagine 11 Range Likert Score 2

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Absent To As Bad as You Can Imagine 11 Range Likert Score 2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A response indicating a situation is as bad as can be imagined.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.: A subjective score of 2 on a Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

Concepts.longName: As Bad as You Can Imagine
Concepts.definition: A response indicating a situation is as bad as can be imagined.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A subjective score of 2 on a Likert scale.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Symptom Severity Score Integer::11 Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: MDASI:M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory, Cleeland et al., 2000
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for RTOG per request by V.Patel. mc 3/19/13 Added numeric alt VM names per request by Vanita for use with Rave. mc 4/2/13 Released per approval. mc 4/18/13
